channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree heavily overhanging properties 43 and 45 Cromwell Road., 17th July
item.description:
I have reported this tree for being heavily overgrown for months, if not years. I have warned of the dangers it poses being so overgrown and the measures you have taken (top lift) have only exasperated the issue. During the recent flash storm, the tree was being heavily blown around, I went out to check and a branch broke off and hit me. I have two young children, as does my neighbour, this tree is a danger to our properties, but more importantly, our families. If an accident happens, full blame will be placed at the councils door. I have escalated through this channel, I have called the council directly and involved our councillor, if the tree is not cut back, and an accident happens, you will all be held accountable. Please have someone cut the tree well back ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadside litter all along the Marylebone flyover /A40, 17th July
item.description:
Street litter dotting the sides of nearly the entire stretch of Marylebone flyover /A40 on both sides . It’s just shocking .. I’ve never seen so much stuff on the roadside and some bang in the middle in 15 years ! I would have added more photos but there was a limit . It’s been like this for weeks or even months .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westway, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bush on Manor rd corner taking up pavement space., 17th July
item.description:
This bush on Manor rd N16 corner has been allowed to over grow over many months and now is taking up much of the pavement. Also, there are overgrown bushes either side of it with large concrete slabs on that corner, for what reason, I cannot tell.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Gas bottles behind NURSERY!, 17th July
item.description:
Multiple gas bottles have been dumped behind our nursery, which backs onto the children's room. This is very dangerous, please can they be removed urgently.

item.title: Refurb rubbish dumped outside Orbit Cleaners, 17th July
item.description:
Orbit Cleaners had a major refurbishment and whilst this has been going on, they kept lots of rubbish on the pavement. Whilst a lot of this has been removed, they still have some, including a large wooden panel, which is actually dangerous to pedestrians using the footpath, particularly familiare with young kids, considering it’s very close to both the station and a nursery nearby. We would like to ask the Council to ensure this business quickly disposes of the rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown bushes and weeds, 17th July
item.description:
Overgrown bushes , weeds , trees , grass , just doesn’t get maintained , this is making the estate unsafe for children , women , girls you can’t walk out of the estate via entrance near children park at night very scary , if anybody hiding near park you wouldn’t be able to see, we have a lot of problems with drugs anti social behaviour, robbery etc , this area is going to be used a lot soon has local schools go on summer break, Since Southwark changed street lights it made the area very dark and unsafe ???? Hope this can be rectified soon
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left by trees, 17th July
item.description:
There is constant dumping of rubbish by the trees on Powerscroft Rd. Previously this was dealt with daily by the street sweepers but they rarely come now and the rubbish builds up and people think it’s ok to dump and fly tip on the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London

item.title: There is fly tipping of garden waste, pallets, bits furniture mats and rubble, 17th July
item.description:
